name: subjectively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is influenced by or based on personal beliefs or feelings, rather than based on facts: Patients vary in how they subjectively score their pain. The choice must be reasonable both objectively and subjectively. See
subjective
More examplesFewer examplesYou see them subjectively not objectively.Allowing teachers to subjectively grade students could create a whole series of issues.A hallucination is a subjectively experienced sensation which is not caused by an actual appropriate stimulus, but which is regarded by the individual as real.
